intro: Ribes leptanthum var. quercetorum, commonly known as the red elderberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, showy white or pinkish flowers that appear in early spring. These flowers give way to bright red,浆果-like berries in the summer, which are edible when fully ripe. The shrub is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
